page.title: 01Mark Gazetteer
page.content: Mark is a{village}of approximately 2.5 miles in length from East to West. It lies deep in the heart of Somerset. Highbridge and Burnham-on-Sea are 4 miles to the West. The nearest town East of Mark is Wedmore 4 miles away. There are several small hamlets lying within a 3 mile radius of the Causeway,which runs through the village.Yarrow and Southwick lie to the South and Northwick and Vole lie to the North. This village of 1000+ inhabitants is mainly a farming community with many fine dairy herds living off good moist grazing land. Many small local industries have survived and flourish. Young people are well catered for with sports facilities and halls for youth activities. There is a small tourist trade existing amicably with retired locals and "foreigners" alike.
